li.onclick: openModalInline("New York on PAUSE Extended - Schools to Remain Closed... (click to read more)", 650, 500, "#article-details-7993" )

span.b: New York on PAUSE Extended - Schools to Remain Closed... (click to read more)

div.h3: New York on PAUSE Extended - Schools to Remain Closed
div.p: At his daily press briefing on April 16, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced the extension of New York on PAUSE through May 15. For the Islip Schools, this means that our buildings must remain closed with distance learning protocols continuing at least through that date. All non-essential businesses will also remain closed.
In addition, we learned today that the Special Olympics Long Island Spring Games South Islip was scheduled to host on June 6, 2020 have also been cancelled.

We cannot thank our community enough for their patience and understanding through these difficult times. Our teachers, administrators, and support staff miss seeing our students and are looking forward to a time in the (hopefully) not too distant future when they can see everyone again. Be safe and be well, Islip!

div.h3: Virtual Board of Education Meeting - April 21, 2020

div.p: The next meeting of the Islip Board of Education will be held on Tuesday, April 21st, beginning at 9:00 a.m. This will once again be a virtual meeting through the Zoom platform, and no on-site public participation will be allowed. Please visit our Zoom meeting registration page to sign-up as a participant.Once you do so, you will be emailed a personal link and password to enter the meeting. In addition, a recording and transcription of the meeting will be posted on the District website as soon as feasibly possible after the conclusion of the meeting.
The Budget Workshop planned for this meeting has been postponed. New workshop dates will be announced once we have more information from the state.

The agenda for the meeting will be available to the public on Monday, April 20th in BoardDocs on the District website. The Board requests that any public questions on agenda items be emailed to BofEducation@islipufsd.org prior to the start of the meeting. Please include your name and address with your question.
Thank you for your continued understanding.

img.alt: MailTo Islip School District - Census 2020
img.title: MailTo Share Button

div.div:
By now, all residents in Islip should have received a letter from the U.S. Census Bureau with instructions to complete the 2020 Census questionnaire online, as well as a Census ID for the household.
Completing the U.S. Census is one of the most important steps a parent and the community can take to secure the future of the District's students. Your responses ensure accurate counts which will set funding levels for schools, special education services, health insurance, food distribution programs, and much more for the next TEN YEARS. If the District is undercounted, it would mean less funding from the federal government and less representation in the House of Representative, lessening the community's voice. Therefore, when completing the Census, it is important to count EVERYONE in your household, including infants and toddlers.
Every child on Long Island deserves the opportunity to succeed. By taking ten minutes to complete the 2020 U.S. Census, you are helping provide them with that chance. If you have questions before you begin, please visit the Help & FAQs page of the U.S. Census website for more information.
